Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effects of CPB-Induced Shear Stress on Monocyte-Endothelial Interactions

Trial_Design.evidence: This in vitro randomised controlled trial used THP-1 monocyte-like cells and human neonatal dermal microvascular endothelial cells (HNDMVECs).

Intervention.evidence: THP-1 cells were subjected to shear stress in polyvinyl chloride tubing at 2.1 Pa for 2 hours.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of CPB-induced shear stress on monocyte-endothelial interactions.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the level of IL-8 production and monocyte adhesion, measured over 6 hours.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sheared THP-1 cells showed increased adhesion and transmigration through the HNDMVEC monolayer compared to static controls.
